title: Motorola Edge 60 leaks in official-looking renders
description: When it rains Motorola leaks, it pours, it seems. We've already seen a bunch of promo materials for the upcoming Razr 60 Ultra outed today, and now it's time to turn our attention to the Edge 60, which will soon join the already announced Edge 60 Fusion. excerpt: It has a very familiar design. When it rains Motorola leaks, it pours, it seems. We've already seen a bunch of promo materials for the upcoming Razr 60...
text: When it rains Motorola leaks, it pours, it seems. We've already seen a bunch of promo materials for the upcoming Razr 60 Ultra outed today, and now it's time to turn our attention to the Edge 60, which will soon join the already announced Edge 60 Fusion. This is the star of some leaked official-looking renders, showcasing it in blue and green. Naturally, the design language of the Edge 60 is incredibly close to that of the Edge 60 Fusion. Motorola Edge 60 leaked renders in blue The Edge 60 is said to sport a 50 MP main camera using the Sony Lytia LYT-700C sensor, and a 13 MP ultrawide along with a 3-in-1 light sensor. The Edge 60 is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 7400 SoC, paired with 8/12GB of RAM and 256/512GB of storage. Motorola Edge 60 leaked renders in green It will run Android 15 out of the box when it launches, and will be promised to receive 3 major Android updates and 4 years of security updates. As you can see from the images, the rear will be fake leather. The screen will be protected by Gorilla Glass 7i. The phone will be IP68 and IP69 rated for dust and water resistance, and it will have an in-display fingerprint scanner as well as support for AquaTouch. Keeping the lights on will be a 5,500 mAh battery with support for 65W wired charging. So basically, it's looking like this will be the Indian Edge 60 Fusion, just launched internationally. Source
html:
When it rains Motorola leaks, it pours, it seems. We've already seen a bunch of promo materials for the upcoming Razr 60 Ultra outed today, and now it's time to turn our attention to the Edge 60, which will soon join the already announced Edge 60 Fusion.

This is the star of some leaked official-looking renders, showcasing it in blue and green. Naturally, the design language of the Edge 60 is incredibly close to that of the Edge 60 Fusion.


Motorola Edge 60 leaked renders in blue

The Edge 60 is said to sport a 50 MP main camera using the Sony Lytia LYT-700C sensor, and a 13 MP ultrawide along with a 3-in-1 light sensor. The Edge 60 is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 7400 SoC, paired with 8/12GB of RAM and 256/512GB of storage.


Motorola Edge 60 leaked renders in green

It will run Android 15 out of the box when it launches, and will be promised to receive 3 major Android updates and 4 years of security updates. As you can see from the images, the rear will be fake leather. The screen will be protected by Gorilla Glass 7i.

The phone will be IP68 and IP69 rated for dust and water resistance, and it will have an in-display fingerprint scanner as well as support for AquaTouch. Keeping the lights on will be a 5,500 mAh battery with support for 65W wired charging.

So basically, it's looking like this will be the Indian Edge 60 Fusion, just launched internationally.

Source
